user_request: A Father's Day poem about a dad being a hero and role model.
final_poem:
Beneath the weight of endless skies,  
He lifts the world with silent sighs,  
A compass forged in steady hands,  
A lighthouse where his children stand.  

Through storms he walks, a shield unbroken,  
In every scar, a story spoken—  
Not of the brave, but those who stay,  
To mend the cracks of yesterday.  

His laughter rings in midnight air,  
A spark that turns the dark to care,  
His patience, deep as ancient stone,  
A fortress where his children own.  

No cape, no sword, yet still he leads,  
With love as fierce as any creed.  
A hero’s heart, a father’s grace—  
The world is built on his unswayed face.  

So here’s to dads who bear the light,  
Who turn the ordinary into right.  
In every step, a legacy—  
The greatest gift is being free.
